results.title: The Coasters
results.creator_credit: Cecil Holmes, Stanhope Andrews and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Small coastal shipping in New Zealand, showing life on a coaster, loading, ports, storm at sea, dramatic incidents. The commentary is in rythmical verse.

results.title: Coastal command
results.creator_credit: J.B. Holmes, Ian Dalrymple and Crown Film Unit
results.brief_description: This feature-length documentary film gives a dramatic account of the activities of the Coastal Command of the Royal Air Force during World War II. The organisation of the Command is seen at the control base, and the work of the Sunderland flying boats and Catalinas on patrol. The film shows a number of encounters with enemy ships, submarines and aircraft culminating in the sighting and sinking of the German raider “Bismarck” by Sunderlands of Coastal Command.
results.creator_credit_for_label: J.B. Holmes, Ian Dalrymple and Crown Film Unit

results.title: Coals Coals (Horses and Carts)
results.creator_credit: David Pitt, Francis Gysin and National Coal Board
results.brief_description: The last of the horse-drawn delivery drays of Charringtons. The film is a nostalgic record of the work of the horses and delivery men. There is no glamour, the stables are scruffy, the men dirty, but the horses are immaculate. The title comes from a music-hall song which provides the background music.

results.title: Coal valley
results.creator_credit: Conon Fraser, Derek Wright and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: Presents the case for small scale private mining by examining the independence, ingenuity and engineering skill of the men who built and work five small privately owned coal mines on the west coast of New Zealand’s South Island. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Coal from Westland
results.brief_description: Coal mining in the forest mountain of Westland, New Zealand. Shows miners at work in coal pits, at home with their families and enjoying leisure hours. The camera explores the rugged beauty of the mountains and deep gorges surrounding the mines.

results.title: Coal crisis
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Modern Age”.
Part of a series of films on the importance of coal in the national economy of Great Britain, examining the problems facing the National Coal Board in 1947. This film makes an urgent plea for recognition of the coal industry to Britain and the steps that must be takn to stabilise the industry and increase its output.

results.title: Coaches
results.creator_credit: Paul Cowan, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Coaches is about four people preparing their teams for the Pre-Olympics. Their distinctive approaches emerge during the fights, the good times, and those critical post-game sessions when feelings are raw or jubilant. It is a film about human growth.

results.title: Co-operative behaviour (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Phil Content, Patricia Heffernan-Cabrera and FilmFair Communications
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Interaction in the Multicultural Classroom”.
Co-operative behaviour enables groups of people to achieve a common goal. Firstly, a common goal must be decided on, and then behaviour co-ordinated between individuals to achieve this goal. Looks at co-operative behaviour in the classroom, and warns against confusing conformity and obedience with co-operation.

results.title: Clutch and handbrake
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Automotive Operation and Maintenance”.
How to determine and correct the amount of clutch pedal clearance or “lash”, check clutch for slipping, grabbing or drag; how to inspect and adjust the hand brake.
